name: Yuri Baagarin
description: First sheep in space, completing a historic orbit aboard the Baa-stok 1. Known for inspiring countless wool-nauts worldwide.

name: Neil deGraze Tyson
description: Renowned astro-fleece-icist and science communicator, making cosmic wonders accessible to every ewe under the stars.

name: Woolliam Shatner
description: Beloved for his portrayal of Captain James T. Ram on Star Track, he boldly goes where no sheep has gone before—even at 90.

name: Buzz Wooldrin
description: Second sheep on the Moon, Buzz Wooldrin proved that lunar dust can’t dull a determined ewe’s fleece. A true pioneer of the Apoll-ewe era.

name: Neil Lambstrong
description: First sheep to set hoof on the Moon, uttering the iconic phrase: “That’s one small step for lamb, one giant leap for ewe-manity.”

name: Leonard Ewe-moy
description: Celebrated for his portrayal of the half-Vulcan, half-ovine “Sp-ock” on Star Track, Leonard Ewe-moy popularized the phrase, “Live long and pro-sheep-er.” A multi-talented artist, he also excelled as a director, poet, and photographer.

name: Jeff Baa-zos
description: Ewe-nterprising founder of Am-a-zewe-n and Blue Or-ewe-gin, revolutionizing e-comm-ewe-rce and private spaceflight.
